member.name: N:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel
member.summary: Provides classes for interacting with Excel workbooks and performing calculations for those workbooks on an HPC cluster.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient
member.summary: Represents an engine that implements the partition, calculate, and merge model that Microsoft HPC Pack 2019 Services for Excel uses to run calculations in a workbook in parallel on an HPC cluster. The workbook must implement the callback macro framework.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.ErrorHandler
member.summary: An event that is raised when the response handler receives errors from the HPC cluster.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.Version
member.summary: Represents the version of the Excel client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.BeginRun(System.Boolean,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts a calculation asynchronously for the Excel workbook using the partition, calculate, and merge model that Microsoft HPC Pack 2019 Services for Excel uses to run calculations. The calculation runs on the HPC cluster with the head node that you specified when you called the method, unless you specify that the calculation should run on the local computer.
member.returns: An interface to an object that contains information about the status of the asynchronous calculation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels any currently running Excel calculations without closing the SOA session.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.CloseSession
member.summary: Closes the session that you opened by calling the method subject to a default timeout period, and closes all instances of Excel that are running on the compute nodes.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.CloseSession(System.Int32)
member.summary: Closes the session that you opened by calling the method subject to the specified timeout period, and closes all instances of Excel that are running on the compute nodes.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all of the resources that the object allocated.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.EndRun(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a asynchronous calculation from an Excel workbook on an HPC cluster that you began by calling the method.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.Initialize(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the Excel SOA client by creating a new instance of the class to interact with the Excel workbook located at the specified path.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.Initialize(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.Workbook)
member.summary: Initializes the Excel SOA client by creating a new instance of the class to interact with the Excel workbook that is represented by the specified object.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.OpenSession(Microsoft.Hpc.Scheduler.Session.SessionStartInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new SOA session using the settings in the specified object to perform calculations from the specified Excel workbook on an HPC cluster.
member.returns: An that specifies the identifier of the SOA session that the method created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.OpenSession(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.Hpc.Scheduler.Session.SessionUnitType,System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new SOA session using the specified resource settings to perform calculations from the specified Excel workbook on the HPC cluster with the specified head node.
member.returns: An that specifies the identifier of the SOA session that the method created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.Run(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts the calculation for the Excel workbook using the partition, calculate, and merge model that Microsoft HPC Pack 2019 Services for Excel uses to run calculations. The calculation runs on the HPC cluster with the head node that you specified when you called the method, unless you specify that the calculation should run on the local computer.
member.returns: None.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClient.Driver
member.summary: Gets the object that interacts with the currently open Excel workbook.
member.returns: The object that interacts with the currently open Excel workbook.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClientException
member.summary: Indicates that the object encountered an error with a nonspecific cause.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClientException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class without specifying an error message, inner exception, or serialized data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClientException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClientException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelClientException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver
member.summary: Provides a wrapper around an instance of Excel that simplifies starting Excel and interacting with the component object model (COM) objects that represent items in Excel such as the application, workbook, and worksheets.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class without specifying the workbook or instance of Excel that the object should use.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.#ctor(Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.Workbook)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that uses the specified workbook and attaches to the associated Excel application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all of the resources that the object used.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.GetBashedPopups
member.summary: Gets the objects that represent the message boxes that the pop-up blocker dismissed, and clears the internal list of messages.
member.returns: An array of objects that represent the message boxes that the pop-up blocker dismissed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.GetCellValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the values from one or more specified cells in the currently open workbook.
member.returns: A that represents the values in the specified cells.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.LaunchExcelProcess
member.summary: Starts a process running Excel and sets the and properties.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.OpenWorkbook(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the specified Excel workbook on the local computer.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.OpenWorkbook(System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Opens the specified Excel workbook on the local computer if the date that the workbook was last saved matches the specified date.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.OpenWorkbook(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Opens the specified Excel workbook on the local computer if the date that the workbook was last saved matches the specified date, using the specified passwords if the workbook is protected or write-reserved.
member.returns: None.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.RunMacro(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Runs the specified macro with the specified input on the currently open Excel workbook.
member.returns: A object that represents the return value of the macro.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.SetCellValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the values in one or more specified cells in the currently open workbook.
member.returns: None.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.App
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the object that the class uses for component object model (COM) interoperability with the running instance of Excel.
member.returns: The that the class uses for component object model (COM) interoperability with the running instance of Excel.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.ExcelProcess
member.summary: Gets the object that represents the process that is running Excel on the local computer.
member.returns: A object that represents the process that is running Excel on the local computer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.Sheets
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of worksheets in the currently open workbook.
member.returns: A object that represents the collection of worksheets in the currently open workbook.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelDriver.Workbook
member.summary: Gets the currently open Excel workbook.
member.returns: A object that represents the currently open Excel workbook.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.PopupMessage
member.summary: Represents a message box that the pop-up blocker dismissed while running calculations for an Excel workbook on an HPC cluster.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.PopupMessage.MessageText
member.summary: Gets the text of the message in the dismissed message box.
member.returns: A that contains the text of the message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.PopupMessage.TitleBar
member.summary: Gets the text in the title bar of the dismissed message box.
member.returns: A that contains the text in the title bar.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ResponseErrorEventArgs
member.summary: Contains data about errors that occurred in getting responses from the HPC cluster for calculation requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ResponseErrorEventArgs.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified exception.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ResponseErrorEventArgs.ResponseException
member.summary: Gets the exception that the response handler received from the broker.
member.returns: A object that represents the exception that the response handler received from the broker.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.WorkItem
member.summary: Represents a list of parameter values that you want to pass to an Excel macro when performing a calculation for a workbook or a list of results from a calculation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.WorkItem.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class without information about any values for macro parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.WorkItem.#ctor(System.Object[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an array of objects that specify values for the parameters of an Excel macro.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.WorkItem.Deserialize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deserializes the specified string by converting it to the equivalent object.
member.returns: A object that corresponds to the specified array of bytes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.WorkItem.Get``1(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the object at the specified position in the list of objects that the object contains.
member.returns: The object with the type that the type parameter specifies that is at the specified position in the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.WorkItem.GetAll
member.summary: Gets all of the objects that the object contains.
member.returns: An array of the objects that the object contains.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.WorkItem.Insert``1(System.Int32,``0)
member.summary: Inserts an object of the specified type at the specified position in the array of objects that the WorkItem object contains.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.WorkItem.Serialize(Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.WorkItem)
member.summary: Serializes the specified object as an array of bytes that you can use as part of a object.
member.returns: An array of objects that represents the specified .

member.name: N:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.Com
member.summary: Provides the functionality of the class over the Component Object Model (COM).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.Com.ExcelClient
member.summary: Provides the functionality of the class over the Component Object Model (COM).

member.name: N:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService
member.summary: Provides classes and interfaces for custom clients to use to request that the built-in Excel SOA service perform calculations from Excel workbooks on HPC clusters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateRequest
member.summary: Represents a request to the built-in Excel SOA service to perform the calculation in a specified macro for an Excel workbook using the specified input.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateRequest.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class without specifying the macro in the Excel workbook to call or the input for that macro.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class without the specified values for the name of the macro in the Excel workbook that should perform the calculation, the input for that macro, and the date that the Excel workbook was last saved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateRequest.inputs
member.summary: Contains an array of bytes that is a serialized form of a object that represents the values for the parameters that you want to pass as input to the macro that performs the calculation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateRequest.lastSaveDate
member.summary: Contains a structure that specifies the date and time that the Excel Workbook should have most recently been saved in order for the calculation to proceed, or null if the calculation should proceed regardless of the date and the time that the Excel workbook was last saved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateRequest.macroName
member.summary: Contains a string that specifies the name of the macro in an Excel workbook that the built-in Excel SOA service should use to perform the requested calculation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateResponse
member.summary: Represents a response from the built-in Excel SOA service that includes the results of a calculation for an Excel workbook.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateResponse.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateResponse.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified serialized form of the results of the calculation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateResponse.CalculateResult
member.summary: Contains an array of bytes that is a serialized form of a object. This object represents the results of a calculation that you initiated by calling the method for the with a type parameter of .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.IExcelService
member.summary: Represents the built-in service-oriented architecture (SOA) service for performing calculations in Excel workbooks using a Microsoft HPC server. This service is the service that the built-in client represented by the class uses, and is also available for use by custom SOA clients.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.IExcelService.BeginCalculate(Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateRequest,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins a calculation in an Excel workbook requested by the specified object on an HPC cluster asynchronously.
member.returns: An interface to an object that contains information about the status of the asynchronous calculation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.IExcelService.Calculate(Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.CalculateRequest)
member.summary: Performs the calculation in an Excel workbook requested by the specified object on an HPC cluster.
member.returns: A object that includes the results of the calculation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Hpc.Excel.ExcelService.IExcelService.EndCalculate(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a asynchronous calculation from an Excel workbook on an HPC cluster that you began by calling .
member.returns: A that contains the result of the calculation from an Excel workbook.
